page.title: 15Local Government
page.content:
{ Local Government}is run by a parish council numbering{seven voting members who meet regularly to discuss local affairs. Any resident with a query or complaint, approaches a councillor who will bring the matter before the {parish meeting. If{building plans}are approved these go to district council level in Williton. The{general public}is permitted to attend all meetings as{observers } throughout the year, and in April there is a{Parish Assembly,}when the public may make their views known.
The three major parties are represented. Our local Member of Parliament is The Rt. Hon.{Tom King.
